column5: It is very dangerous to go out onto that pier when winds are up. Especially at dark, I don't understand the risks we sometimes take, including myself. More than a few times I have been caught out here on Erie and I know I should have gone in earlier or turned around.  https://www.sachem.ca/news-story/7766978-missing-persons-investigation-underway-in-port-maitland/
He went missing last Tuesday.  They recovered his body on Friday, very sad:  https://www.thespec.com/news-story/7772222-police-locate-body-of-missing-grimsby-man/
When I first read it I thought you meant Fisherman. OFC member lost.   Was relieved to read on  Still always sad to lost anyone
We are always a week behind the news here G. Thanks for the update. Condolences to his family.
That nane rings a bell. I swear there was a Tessone that lost his life at Maitland a few years back.

When I first read it I thought you meant Fisherman. OFC member lost. Was relieved to read on  Still always sad to lost anyone   No, he fishes the Barrie marina docks. Sheltered from the winds and waves bud.  Sad news. Glad the family has closure.
